info.title: User and Access Management API
info.description: REST endpoints for retrieving and managing user and access in your organization.

servers.description: Replace ODC_PORTAL_DOMAIN with the domain of your organization.

get.summary: Returns a list of application roles.
get.description:
Returns a list of application roles that match the specified filters. Use query parameters to refine the search.

API Client needs the **User management > View end users** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The application role key.

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The asset key that the application role belongs to.

parameters.name: environmentKey
parameters.description: Filters application roles by environment key (stage).

parameters.name: nameContains
parameters.description: Filters application roles by name.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Used for sorting the list. Ascending by default. Prepend a hyphen, "-", to get a descending sort, for example "-name". Default: name. Allowed: name, environmentKey or assetKey.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned. Allowed values: 1 to 100 Default value: 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first result returned. Default value: 0.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > View end users** permission.

get.summary: Returns the list of users for the specific application role.
get.description:
Returns a list of users that match the specified filters. Use query parameters to refine the search.

API Client needs the **User management > View end users** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Application role key.

parameters.name: userKey
parameters.description: User's key to search.

parameters.name: nameOrEmailContains
parameters.description: Filters users by name or email address.

parameters.name: nameOrEmailOrUsernameContains
parameters.description: Filters users by name or email address or username.

parameters.name: lastLoginAtSince
parameters.description: Only returns users whose last login occurred on or after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: lastLoginAtTo
parameters.description: Only returns users whose last login occurred before or on the specified date and time.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned. Allowed values: 1 to 100 Default value: 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first result returned. Default value: 0.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Used for sorting the list. Ascending by default. Prepend a hyphen, "-", to get a descending sort, for example "-name". Default: name. Allowed: userKey, name, email, status, lastLoginAt.

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: List of fields to embed in the response.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > View end users** permission.

post.summary: Bulk create users and optionally in the built-in identity provider.
post.description:
Returns an operations status object with an operation key that can be used later to get the status of the bulk create.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage users** permission.
post.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage users** permission.

get.summary: Get the bulk user operation status.
get.description:
Returns an operations status object that contains the overall status of the bulk operation. 

If the bulk operation has a status of 'Finished' or 'FinishedWithErrors', the result of each and every item in the list is returned as well. 

If the bulk operation is 'Pending' or 'Processing', only the overall status is returned.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage users** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key of the operation that was obtained during submitting bulk operation.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage users** permission.

patch.summary: Allow to add or remove users from a group.
patch.description:
Allows adding or removing users from a specified group. Manage group membership by specifying the group key and providing lists of user keys to be added or removed.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The group key.

patch.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

get.summary: Returns a list of users associated with a group.
get.description:
Returns a list of users associated with a group that match the specified filters. Use query parameters to refine the search.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The group's key.

parameters.name: userKey
parameters.description: The user's key.

parameters.name: nameOrEmailContains
parameters.description: Filters users by name or email address.

parameters.name: nameOrEmailOrUsernameContains
parameters.description: Filters users by name or email or username.

parameters.name: lastLoginAtSince
parameters.description: Only returns users whose last login occurred on or after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: lastLoginAtTo
parameters.description: Only returns users whose last login occurred before or on the specified date and time.

parameters.name: membershipType
parameters.description: Filters users by membership type that can be `Assigned` or `Mapped`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned. Allowed values: 1 to 100 Default value: 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first result returned. Default value: 0.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Used for sorting the list. Ascending by default. Prepend a hyphen, "-", to get a descending sort, for example "-name". Default: name. Allowed: key, name, email, status, lastLoginAt.

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: List of fields to embed in the response.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

post.description:
Creates a new group by specifying a name and environment (stage). Optionally, you can include a list of users and application roles to assign to the group during creation.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

requestBody.description: Group object with the necessary information.

post.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

get.summary: Returns the list of groups based on specified conditions.
get.description:
Returns a list of groups that match the specified filters. Use query parameters to refine the search.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

parameters.name: nameContains
parameters.description: Filters users by name.

parameters.name: environmentKey
parameters.description: Only returns groups associated to the specified environment (stage).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned. Allowed values: 1 to 100 Default value: 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first result returned. Default value: 0.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

delete.description:
Deletes a specified group using the group's key.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the group to be deleted.

delete.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

get.description:
Retrieves detailed information about a group, including its name, description, and environment.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Group key.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

patch.description:
Updates the details of a group using the group's key. Allows modification of the group's name or description.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the group to be updated.

requestBody.description: The request object with the new values.

patch.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

patch.summary: Allow to add or remove application roles from a group.
patch.description:
Allows adding or removing application roles from a specified group. Manage roles by specifying the group key and providing lists of application role keys to be added or removed.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The group key.

requestBody.description: Request object with the application role keys to add or remove.

patch.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

get.summary: Returns a list of application roles associated with a group.
get.description:
Returns a list of application roles that match the specified filters. Use query parameters to refine the search.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The group key.

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The asset key.

parameters.name: applicationRoleKey
parameters.description: The application role key.

parameters.name: nameContains
parameters.description: Filters application roles by name.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned. Allowed values: 1 to 100 Default value: 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first result returned. Default value: 0.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Used for sorting the list. Ascending by default. Prepend a hyphen, "-", to get a descending sort, for example "-name". Default: name. Allowed: name, assetkey.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

post.description:
Creates an organization role.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage organization roles** permission.
post.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage organization roles** permission.

get.summary: Returns the list of organization roles.
get.description:
Returns a list of organization roles. Use query parameters to filter the result based on different criteria.

API Client needs at least one User management permission.

parameters.name: roleKey
parameters.description: Organization role key.

parameters.name: nameContains
parameters.description: Filters list by name.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Used for sorting the list. Ascending by default. Prepend a hyphen, "-", to get a descending sort, for example "-name". The default is name. Allowed: name.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned. The value must be within 1 - 100 (both inclusive). The default value is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting point or position of the first result returned. The default value is 0.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs at least one User management permission.

delete.description:
Deletes an organization role.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage organization roles** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Organization role key.

delete.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage organization roles** permission.

get.summary: Returns information for an organization role.
get.description:
Returns details about an organization role based on the organization role key.

API Client needs at least one User management permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Organization role key.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs at least one User management permission.

patch.description:
Updates the details of an organization role based on the organization role key.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage organization roles** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Organization role key.

patch.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage organization roles** permission.

get.description:
Returns all permissions.

Use query parameters to filter the result based on different criteria.

API Client needs at least one User management permission.

parameters.name: nameContains
parameters.description: Filters list by name.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned. The value must be within 1 - 100 (both inclusive). The default value is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting point or position of the first result returned. The default value is 0.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs at least one User management permission.

get.description:
Returns details about a permission based on the permission key.

API Client needs at least one User management permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Permission key.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs at least one User management permission.

post.summary: Grants an application role to a user.
post.description:
Assigns an application role to a user by providing the application role key and the user key.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user access** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: User key.

parameters.name: roleKey
parameters.description: Application role creation request.

post.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user access** permission.

delete.summary: Revokes an application role to a user.
delete.description:
Revokes an application role from a user by providing the user key and application role key.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user access** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: User key.

parameters.name: roleKey
parameters.description: Role key for the application.

delete.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user access** permission.

get.summary: Returns the list of application roles associated with a user.
get.description:
Returns a list of application roles associated with a user that match the specified filters. Use query parameters to refine the search.

API Client needs the **User management > View end users** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: User key.

parameters.name: nameContains
parameters.description: Filters application roles by name.

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: Only returns application roles for the specified asset.

parameters.name: environmentKey
parameters.description: Only returns application roles in the specified environment (stage).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Used for sorting the list. Ascending by default. Prepend a hyphen, "-", to get a descending sort, for example "-name". Default: name. Allowed: name, environmentKey or assetKey.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned. Allowed values: 1 to 100 Default value: 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first result returned. Default value: 0.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > View end users** permission.

get.summary: Returns the list of organization roles associated with a user.
get.description:
Returns a list of organization roles based on the user key.

If the authenticated user is requesting their own roles, no permission is required.

API Client needs the **User management > View members** or **User management > Manage users** permissions.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: User key.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned. The value must be within 1 - 100 (both inclusive). The default value is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting point or position of the first result returned. The default value is 0.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > View members** or **User management > Manage users** permissions.

post.summary: Grant organization roles to a user.
post.description:
Assigns organization roles to a user based on the user key.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage organization access** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: User key.

parameters.name: roleKey
parameters.description: Organization role key.

requestBody.description: Contains role validity period and asset keys for which we assign this organization role.

post.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage organization access** permission.

delete.description:
Revokes organization roles for a user.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage organization access** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: User key.

parameters.name: roleKey
parameters.description: Organization role key.

requestBody.description: Revoke details contains the asset keys for which to revoke the organization role.

delete.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage organization access** permission.

post.description:
Creates a new user by specifying the user information. You can provide the user's name, photo URL, and active status. Additionally, the AddToBuiltInIdentityProvider can be used to add the user to the built-in provider.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage users** permission.

requestBody.description: The user object with the necessary information.

post.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage users** permission.

get.summary: Returns the list of users based on specified conditions.
get.description:
Returns a list of users that match the specified filters. Use query parameters to refine the search.

API Client needs the **User management > View end users** or **User management > View members** or **User management > Manage users** permissions. If API Client has the **User management > View end users** permission, retrieves the list of users with end-user roles. If API Client has the **User management > View members** permission, retrieves the list of users with organization roles. To get a list of all users (with or without roles), the API client needs either both the **User management > View end users** and **User management > View members** permissions, or the **User management > Manage users** permission.

parameters.name: nameOrEmailContains
parameters.description: Filters users by name or email address.

parameters.name: nameOrEmailOrUsernameContains
parameters.description: Filters users by name or email address or username.

parameters.name: userKeys
parameters.description: Only returns users that match the specified keys. For more than one key, separates the keys with a comma. Allows up to 20 user keys.

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: Only returns users that have roles for the specified Asset.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Only returns users with the specified status.

parameters.name: lastLoginAtSince
parameters.description: Only returns users whose last login occurred on or after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: lastLoginAtTo
parameters.description: Only returns users whose last login occurred before or on the specified date and time.

parameters.name: hasOrganizationRoles
parameters.description: When set to true, only returns users that have at least one organization role. Default is false.

parameters.name: hasApplicationRoles
parameters.description: When set to true, only returns users that have at least one application role. Default is false.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Used for sorting the list. Ascending by default. Prepend a hyphen, "-", to get a descending sort, for example "-name". Default: name. Allowed: key, name, email, status, lastLoginAt.

parameters.name: environmentKey
parameters.description: Only returns users that have roles in the specified environment (stage).

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: List of fields to embed in the response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned. Allowed values: 1 to 100 Default value: 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first result returned. Default value: 0.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > View end users** or **User management > View members** or **User management > Manage users** permissions. If API Client has the **User management > View end users** permission, retrieves the list of users with end-user roles. If API Client has the **User management > View members** permission, retrieves the list of users with organization roles. To get a list of all users (with or without roles), the API client needs either both the **User management > View end users** and **User management > View members** permissions, or the **User management > Manage users** permission.

delete.description:
Deletes a specified user using the user's key.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage users** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: User key.

delete.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage users** permission.

get.description:
Retrieves detailed information about a user using the user's key.

API Client needs the **User management > View end users** or **User management > View members** or **User management > Manage users** permissions. If API Client has the **User management > View end users** permission, retrieves the list of users with end-user roles. If API Client has the **User management > View members** permission, retrieves the list of users with organization roles. To get a list of all users (with or without roles), the API client needs either both the **User management > View end users** and **User management > View members** permissions, or the **User management > Manage users** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: User key.

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: List of fields to embed in the response.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > View end users** or **User management > View members** or **User management > Manage users** permissions. If API Client has the **User management > View end users** permission, retrieves the list of users with end-user roles. If API Client has the **User management > View members** permission, retrieves the list of users with organization roles. To get a list of all users (with or without roles), the API client needs either both the **User management > View end users** and **User management > View members** permissions, or the **User management > Manage users** permission.

patch.description:
Updates the details of a user using the user's key. Allows modification of the user's name, photo URL, and active status.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage users** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: User key.

requestBody.description: User object with the information to be updated.

patch.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage users** permission.

get.summary: Returns a list of groups associated with a user.
get.description:
Returns a list of groups associated with a user that match the specified filters. Use query parameters to refine the search.

API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The user key.

parameters.name: nameContains
parameters.description: Filters groups by name.

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: Filters groups by asset key.

parameters.name: environmentKey
parameters.description: Filters groups by environment key. (stage)

parameters.name: membershipType
parameters.description: Filters groups by user's membership type that can be `Assigned` or `Mapped`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned. Allowed values: 1 to 100 Default value: 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first result returned. Default value: 0.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **User management > Manage end-user groups** permission.

name.description: The name of the application role.

externalKey.description: The unique identifier for an application role independently of the environment.

page.description: The details of the page information.

key.description: The identiifer of the bulk operation record

status.description: Bullk API statuses Pending, Processing, Finished and FinishedWithErrors

errorCode.description:
Self Service error code for the overall bulk API operation.

For example, when the operation times out.

errorMessage.description:
Self Service error message for the overall bulk API operation.

For example, when the operation times out.

operations.description:
Details of each operation performed in the bulk request.

Available when the bulk operation has Finished or FinishedWithErrors.

This will be an empty list when the bulk operation is Pending or Progressing.

status.description:
Status of the individual operation in the list of bulk operations.

For example: Inserted, Updated, Errored

errorCode.description: Self-support error code for the one operation if any error occured.

errorMessage.description: Self-support error message for the one operation if any error occured.

record.description:
A JSON object containing some extra info about the record in this operation.

This could contain some pieces of request info as well as additional info from the operation output.

environmentKey.description: The environment key to associate with the group.

applicationRoleKeys.description: The application role keys to associate with the group.

userKeys.description: The user keys to associate with the group.

grantPeriod.description: Gets or sets the grant period.

assetKeys.description: Gets or sets the asset keys.

startTime.description: The start date and time in utc.

endTime.description: The end date and time in utc.

updatedAt.description: The last updated date and time of the group.

page.description: The details of the page information.

membershipTypes.description: The list of membership types of this user in this group. Allowed values are 'Assigned' (if directly added to the group) or 'Mapped' (if added via group mappings).

GroupUser.description: Represents a user in a group.

page.description: The details of the page information.

status.description: The user's status. Allowed values are 'Active', 'Inactive', 'PendingRegistration' and 'Invited'.

photoUrl.description: A URL pointing to the user's photo.

lastLoginAt.description: The date of the last time the user logged in.

embedded.description: The embedded information to provide. (optional) Only available when the request includes the query parameter `embed=`, e.g. `embed=userIdentityProviders`

GroupUserProfile.description: The profile of a group member.

key.description: Gets or sets organization role key.

name.description: Gets or sets organization role name.

grantPeriod.description: Gets or sets the period during which the role is valid.

assetKey.description: Gets or sets the asset key.

page.description: The details of the page information.

name.description: Gets or sets the name of Organization Role.

permissions.description: Gets or sets the list of permissions for the Organization Role.

orgRoleKey.description: Gets or sets the Organization Role Key.

key.description: Gets or sets the organization role key.

name.description: Gets or sets the organization role name.

isReadOnly.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the organization role is readonly.

page.description: The details of the page information.

name.description: Gets or sets the name of the organization role.

permissions.description: Gets or sets the list of permissions for the organization role.

count.description: The results of the current page.

limit.description: The limit of results per page.

offset.description: The offset of the current page of results.

nextPageOffset.description: The offset of the next page of results. (optional)

totalPages.description: The total number of pages with results.

applicationRoleKeysToAdd.description: The list of application role keys to add to the group.

applicationRoleKeysToRemove.description: The list of application role keys to remove from the group.

userKeysToAdd.description: The list of user keys to add to the group.

userKeysToRemove.description: The list of user keys to remove from the group.

permissionKey.description: Gets or sets the permission key.

environmentKeys.description: Gets or sets the environment keys.

claimName.description: Gets or sets the claim name.

name.description: Gets or sets the permission name.

key.description: Gets or sets the permission key.

name.description: Gets or sets the permission name.

category.description: Gets or sets the category for the permission.

purpose.description: Gets or sets the purpose for the permission.

visibility.description: Gets or sets the visibility for the permission.

allowStages.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether permission applies to a specific stage.

allowedScopes.description: Gets or sets the allowed scopes.

claimName.description: Gets or sets the claim name.

page.description: The details of the page information.

key.description: Gets or sets the permission key.

realmStages.description: Gets or sets the realm stage list.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation of the error.

instance.description: A URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

traceId.description: This field helps OutSystems support track and investigate specific error occurrences. Providing this identifier when reporting an issue allows for more precise and faster troubleshooting.

errorCode.description: This error code serves the purpose to communicate with OutSystems Support and help diagnose errors.

ProblemDetails.description: A standardized error response as per RFC 7807 (Problem Details for HTTP APIs).

assetKeys.description: Gets or sets the asset keys.

lastLoginAt.description: The timestamp of the last login (or token refresh) for this user in UTC.

_embedded.description:
The embedded information to provide. (optional)

Only available when the request includes the query parameter `embed=`,

e.g. `embed=userIdentityProviders`

page.description: The details of the page information.

membershipTypes.description: The list of membership types of the user in this group. Allowed values are 'Assigned' (if directly added to the group) or 'Mapped' (if added via group mappings).

group.description: A group that a user is part of.

UserGroupResponse.description: Represents a group that a user is part of.

page.description: The details of the page information.

subject.description: The subject claims in the token issued by the IdP.

firstLoginAt.description: The timestamp of the first login for this user using the idp in UTC.

lastLoginAt.description: The timestamp of the last login for this user using the idp in UTC.

isEmailVerified.description: The value indicating whether or not the user's email is verified.

lastLoginAt.description: The timestamp of the last login (or token refresh) for this user in UTC.

isActive.description: The value indicating whether user profile is active or not.

isEmailVerified.description: The value indicating whether or not the user's email is verified.

isTermsAndConditionsAccepted.description: The value indicating whether or not the user has accepted the terms and conditions.

_embedded.description:
The embedded information to provide. (optional)

Only available when the request includes the query parameter `embed=`,

e.g. `embed=applicationRoles`

isActive.description: Sets the user as active. Default is true (active).

addToBuiltInIdentityProvider.description: Creates the user in the built-in identity provider. Default is false (not created in the built-in identity provider).

page.description: The details of the page information.

isActive.description: The user as active or inactive.
